basics.name: Pangmiaomiao Zhang
basics.label: PhD Candidate in Chemistry
basics.summary: A Chemistry PhD candidate at the University of Texas at Austin specializing in single-molecule biophysics, high-speed atomic force microscopy (HS-AFM), and structural biology of SARS-CoV-2 proteins.

location.address: Robert A. Welch Hall, 105 E 24th St

work.name: Department of Chemistry, University of Texas at Austin
work.position: Graduate Research Assistant (Advisor: Prof. Yi-Chih Lin)
work.summary: Real-time structural and functional studies of biomolecules using high-speed atomic force microscopy (HS-AFM), cryo-EM, and cryo-ET.
highlights: Real-time visualization of SARS-CoV-2 spike proteins and interactions with neutralizing antibodies using HS-AFM
Real-time visualization of G2L4 reverse transcriptase in DNA repair by microhomology-mediated end joining (MMEJ)
Structural and functional investigation of SARS-CoV-2 membrane proteins using HS-AFM, TEM, and cryo-ET
Research supported by an NIH Maximizing Investigators' Research Award ($1.95M)

work.name: Department of Chemistry, Tsinghua University
work.position: Graduate Research Assistant (Advisor: Prof. Chunyan Tan)
work.summary: Developed fluorescence sensor arrays for biomolecular discrimination and enzyme detection.
highlights: Developed cross-reactive fluorescence sensor arrays for discrimination of amyloid beta 42 aggregates (first author, Anal. Chem. 2022)
Detection of histone acetylation related enzymes using conjugated polyelectrolytes

work.name: Department of Chemistry, SUSTech
work.position: Undergraduate Research Assistant (Advisor: Prof. Pengfei Li)
highlights: Catalyst-free cycloaddition reaction for spiro scaffolds

work.name: Texas Venture Lab
work.summary: Market research and financial modeling for biotech startup.
highlights: Conducted market research, competitive analysis, and financial modeling for Synvect, a biological start-up applying gene-editing to control mosquito populations
Research focus: Single-molecule biophysics using HS-AFM and cryo-EM

publications.summary: Co-first author. Established phosphine-catalyzed methodology for [4+1] cycloaddition to obtain chiral 2-pyrrolines with high yields and good enantioselectivities.
